message.content: {"responses": [{"question_id": "TT4G35A", "input_statement": "Artificial intelligence helps teachers write or improve lesson plans.", "response": "Agree"}, {"question_id": "TT4G35B", "input_statement": "Artificial intelligence enables teachers to adapt learning material to different students' abilities.", "response": "Agree"}, {"question_id": "TT4G35C", "input_statement": "Artificial intelligence assists teachers in supporting students individually.", "response": "Agree"}, {"question_id": "TT4G35D", "input_statement": "Artificial intelligence supports students with specific needs (e.g. multilingual learners, students with special education needs).", "response": "Agree"}, {"question_id": "TT4G35E", "input_statement": "Artificial intelligence helps teachers automate administrative tasks.", "response": "Strongly agree"}, {"question_id": "TT4G35F", "input_statement": "Artificial intelligence enables students to misrepresent others' work as their own.", "response": "Agree"}, {"question_id": "TT4G35G", "input_statement": "Artificial intelligence makes recommendations that may not be appropriate or correct.", "response": "Agree"}, {"question_id": "TT4G35H", "input_statement": "Artificial intelligence amplifies biases that reinforce students' misconceptions.", "response": "Agree"}, {"question_id": "TT4G35I", "input_statement": "Artificial intelligence jeopardises the privacy and security of student data.", "response": "Agree"}, {"question_id": "TT4G35J", "input_statement": "Artificial intelligence suggests unsuitable pedagogical approaches that teachers would use with students.", "response": "Agree"}]}
message.reasoning_content:
As a Finnish primary or secondary school teacher, I need to respond to these AI-related statements with thoughtful, balanced perspectives. Let me consider each one:

[TT4G35A]: AI helping with lesson plans - This is generally true. AI tools can assist with generating ideas and drafting lesson plans. I would say "Agree"

[TT4G35B]: AI adapting material to different abilities - This is a promising capability of AI. With proper implementation, AI can personalize learning materials. I would say "Agree"

[TT4G35C]: AI assisting with individual student support - AI can help with personalized feedback and support, though nothing replaces human connection. I would say "Agree"

[TT4G35D]: AI supporting students with specific needs - AI can be very helpful for multilingual learners and those with special needs (text-to-speech, speech-to-text, translations, etc.). I would say "Agree"

[TT4G35E]: AI automating administrative tasks - This is clearly true. AI can handle grading, attendance, scheduling etc. I would say "Strongly agree"

[TT4G35F]: AI enables students to misrepresent others' work as their own - This is a genuine concern. AI makes plagiarism easier. I would say "Agree"

[TT4G35G]: AI makes inappropriate or incorrect recommendations - This is a real risk. AI systems can make errors or provide biased recommendations. I would say "Agree"

[TT4G35H]: AI amplifies biases and misconceptions - This is a documented concern in AI. I would say "Agree"

[TT4G35I]: AI jeopardizes privacy and security of student data - This is a significant concern as AI systems often require data. I would say "Agree"

[TT4G35J]: AI suggests unsuitable pedagogical approaches - This is possible if AI isn't properly guided by educational experts. I would say "Agree"

Let me now format these responses properly for the function call.
